poem:
Purple Echoes  

In the stillness,   
a soundscape blooms—   
notes, unchained,   
hover like petals,   
unseen, but known.   
A prism of silence   
captures his essence—   
held in abeyance,   
the reel reimagined,   
unspools once more   
under watchful eyes.   

Prince's echo—   
both withheld and shared,   
a vault of purple dreams,   
still breathing.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Prince estate blocks release of Netflix documentary by Oscar-winning director Ezra Edelman The estate of the late funk superstar Prince has successfully blocked the release of a nine-hour Netflix documentary about him, made by the Oscar-winning creator of OJ: Made in America. Netflix said in a statement to the Minnesota Star Tribune: “The Prince Estate and Netflix have come to a mutual agreement that will allow the estate to develop and produce a new documentary". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Prince estate blocks release of Netflix documentary by Oscar-winning director Ezra Edelman The estate of the late funk superstar Prince has successfully blocked the release of a nine-hour Netflix documentary about him, made by the Oscar-winning creator of OJ: Made in America.
